citation.article-title: Dyadobacter fermentans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel gram-negative bacterium isolated from surface-sterilized Zea mays stems.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Dyadobacter (Dy.a.do.bac'ter. G. n. dyas two in number, pair; L. masc. n. bacter from the Gr. n. baktron rod or staff ; M.L. n. Dyadobacter rod or staff occurring in pairs)
Gram-negative rods in straight to curved arrangements, occurring in pairs in young culture and forming chains of coccoid cells in old cultures.
Cells produce a non-diffusible, yellow, flexirubin-like pigment.
Aerobic and chemoorganotrophic, capable of fermenting glucose and sucrose.
Does not hydrolyse cellulose or starch.
Isolated from surface-sterilized Zea mays stems.
Phylogenetic position is the Flexibacter group of the Cytophaga–Flexibacter– Bacteroides phylum.
Closest related genera are Runella and Microscilla.
